fields.title: ---- How to use ----
fields.contents:
This is for frequently asked questions, guides to complicated tasks, and anything else that would be a useful reference for staff. Anyone can add or update entries.

The contents are treated like html to allow for more formatting. To insert line breaks, use <br>

If you have a question or problem that's not addressed here, you can get help by using the online form or sending an email to techsupport@socialjusticefund.org

fields.title: Accounts
fields.contents:
User objects store the email and password used to log in to Project Central, the online grant app, and/or the admin site. Users are not tied to one app in particular. A User may be tied to a Member (Project Central) or an Organization (grant app).

See subsections for information on handling admin, project member and organization accounts.

fields.title: Accounts - organizations
fields.contents:
All organizations should register at /apply/register.

To reset an org's password:
  • An org can reset their password on this page OR
  • You can reset their password by finding their User (search by org name or email), selecting it and then using the link at the top.
To change the login email for an org:
  1. Find the User associated with that org and change the email.
  2. Find the Organization, and change the "login" field to match the User
To approve an account:
If an organization registers and there is already data on that org in the system (from a sponsored grant or imported grants data), they will need admin approval before they can use the grant application.
  1. Select the associated User (search by org name or email)
  2. Check the "active" checkbox and hit Save

fields.title: Accounts - admin
fields.contents:
Accessing the admin site:
This admin site is accessed by having a User account with superuser privileges.

Creating an admin account
If the user will want to access Project Central at all

They should register there to create their account. Then, someone who already has admin site access should find their User (search by name or email) and edit it so that superuser is checked.

If only admin site access is needed

Go to the Users section of the admin site and create a new User for them, making sure superuser is checked.

fields.title: Accounts - Project Central
fields.contents:
First-time users should register at /fund/register.

For each giving project that a user is part of, they will have a Membership.

Approving accounts
If a user was on a giving project's pre-approved list when they registered, their membership will automatically be approved.
Otherwise, an admin will need to approve it. You can filter memberships to show only those that have not been approved,
and you can select several and use the dropdown menu at the top to approve all of them).
